title: Drawing, "Design for Wedding Canopy", 1961
medium: White chalk, pen and brown ink on brown textured paper
signed: Signed and dated in pen and brown ink, lower right:  Trude Guermonprez/1961
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower left:  WEDDING CANOPY IN MANY SHADES OF WHITE AND NATURAL LINEN/WITH SUBTLE TRACES OF SILVER AND GOLD/WOVEN AS A TAPESTRY IN THE TECHNIQUE OF PRECOLOMBIAN/DOUBLE WEAVE RESEMBLING DAMASK
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Canopy design in the form of a horizontal, fringed shawl with a six-pointed star on right end and four Hebrew characters ["Shin"] at left end.  Beneath design is small image of canopy supported on four poles.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Wedding Canopy", 1961.White chalk, pen and brown ink on brown textured paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-53.
